runs.comm: short and wide and Finch slaps it to the man at cover. Lucky escape there
top-edge but it falls in no-man's land. There was long-on and deep midwicket and he backed himself to bisect them. Instead he bisects short third man and short fine leg
tossed up on middle as White chips down and nudges to long-on. He's bowling around the wicket, by the way
flighted just outside off and he drills it to mid-off
stray once, you're naive. Stray twice, you're asking for trouble. Finch rocked back and cuts the short ball to the right of point. Strong stroke
smashed back down the ground. That was sheer power! Full and straight went JP, but Finch opened up his stance and flat-batted this with murderous intent. No chance for long-on
touch of movement into the batsman, who rides it and works down towards fine leg
shortish and on off stump, Finch goes back and defends with soft hands
short ball and he has dragged this from outside off to deep midwicket. Inspects the bottom of the bat as he jogs over for a couple. Didn't time it properly at all
good length ball just outside off, dabbed towards point
138kph, ugly swipe over the leg side earns a stare from Tsotsobe as the ball beats the bat. Angled across him and that works in favour of the bowler
cut away and White wins the battle this over. Poor ball as this is short and wide, the batsman jumps to get on top of the bounce and flays it to the right of point
137 kph, full and just outside off, pushed down to mid-on
too much room on offer and Finch has laid into that. Thumped into the surface and it hares off to the point boundary. He'd better keep it full and straight if South Africa want to defend this
full on middle and leg, Finch flicks it away to deep midwicket
short and he strays down leg. Sits up on this slow pitch and White has pulled it behind square. Miller runs miles to his left and dives, but still cannot pull it back
fullish on middle and off, White drives to mid-off who runs to his right, picks it up on the dive, rolls over and is ready to throw. It's the captain over there
138kph, cut him in half! This ducks back in off a length and White was already looking to push into the off side. Can't adjust in time and this ball sneaks through bat and pad

right through the man at point, it's AB who makes a meal of it! Shortish ball just outside off, Finch rides it and this seemed headed straight to point, but a bad bounce allows the ball to sneak through him
short and wide, they are not learning here. Finch loves that as he rocks back and slaps it behind point
full and outside off, drives to mid-off and Faf has to dive full-length to his right again. Almost a collision between the batsman as they ran through for the single

through AB again! This one was hit so hard. Shortish ball angled across him and White has powered a back foot square drive which goes head-high to AB as he sank to his knees. Didn't expect it to bounce so much
another shortish ball drilled to point and AB has some trouble again. The crowd lay into him and he waves a hand in apology
fullish and just outside off, White opens his shoulders and lofts this over mid-off. Holds up inside the boundary
138kph, starts of with a short one angled across him. Finch was on the back foot and pulls. Doesn't get hold of it though

142kph, what a shot! It was short again and this time he has nailed it. There was a man posted to stop that very shot and he only had to move a couple of steps. Still this was so well hit that he had no chance
144kph, full and on off stump, Finch finds mid-on with a powerful drive
slower ball, dragged short and with some room outside off. Finch waits for it and flays it over backward point. Imran Tahir gets a workout at deep third man. How long until he comes on, d'you think?
there's the wicket! Goes for the upper cut as this was dug in short and just outside off. Got far too much height on this and Tahir, at deep third man, collects a good catch
that is a top shot! Drive on the up and through extra cover. Such balance from Finch. Just edged forward but he let his hands go and his timing is amazing
allows this back of a length ball to almost go past him before he dabs to deep third man
shortish on leg stump, Finch is cramped for room and nudges this towards midwicket
good length ball just outside off and he guides it down to third man again
140kph, good length ball on middle, Finch pushes to mid-on, who is on the edge of the circle
full on leg stump and he's flicked this over midwicket with the minimum of fuss. Didn't care about the fielders inside the circle because he backed himself to clear them

slower ball, kept full on leg stump and it almost does the trick. Watson tried to adjust his flick as he looked to loft this over mid-on. But he has been hampered by the lack of pace on this and it falls just short of a rushing mid-on
quick and short on middle and leg and Finch pulls to deep square leg
lovely bowling there. This is flighted on middle and turns just a touch. Watson respects it with a forward defence
little bit more bounce as this is a leggie sliding down leg. Gets a top edge that goes up in the air, but falls short of short fine leg
that was the googly and it turned sharply too. Finch had no clue until it came at him. Keeps it out
moves way outside leg and the bowler serves up a full toss on off stump, bunted down to long-on
tossed up on middle and off and Watson lunges forward and sweeps all along the ground to deep square leg
extracts some seam and bounce straight away. Back of a length and outside off, Watson goes for a cut and he plays under it
fullish on off stump, Watson had cleared his front leg and was looking for the big smear, but then thinks better of it. Dabs into the covers for a single
fullish on off stump, Finch still stays back and opens the face towards point. Quick single, well taken

137kph, there wasn't too much room there, but he played the length. This was shortish and just outside off, Watson stays beside it and leaps up on impact. Flays this between deep third man and the sweeper. Unbelievable shot
137kph, full on middle and off, Watson strides forward and punches to down to long-on
full and outside off, Finch eases forward and drives strongly to mid-off.

he's gone! Tahir has done the trick! This was tossed up and Finch goes for the slog sweep. Doesn't get good enough bat and this gains too much height towards deep midwicket. Miller's there and he clings on to an important catch
good length ball, pushed through quicker on off stump. Watson stays back and blocks
much slower this time as he flights it on leg stump, Watson goes for the sweep and gets it off the back of the bat. Evades the keeper but not short fine leg
flighted on leg stump at 95kph, worked away to deep midwicket

this one rips right across the outside edge! Tahir is gutted that didn't take a nick. Deserved one too as this is tossed up on off stump and gains loads of deviation and bounce too. Beats Watson's searching forward press
fires it quick and flat on leg stump and Watson cannot connect with a pull. Struck on the thigh
short ball outside off, Maxi pulls from outside off towards midwicket. Came off the bottom of the blade there

142kph, shortish and outside off, Watson dabs towards point and Maxi has set off! Early call of no and AB first the throw in from point. Maxi was running back and would never have made it. The throw hits him, but he was not changing course so he won't be out obstructing
fullish on the pads, whipped through midwicket
136kph,lovely bouncer and Maxi prefers not to play. Great height just over shoulder and if the batsman wanted to hook, he had to fetch it from just outside off.
141kph, loud appeal for caught behind, but the ump's spreading his arms for the wide. This was short and down leg. Goes for the hook this time and doesn't connect
slower length ball on off stump, he goes for a heave over midwicket and gets a leading edge to deep third man
on the pads and he picks it away to deep fine leg
googly again from Tahir and the batman's wasn't too comfy with it. Just about manages to nudge it in front of point
had set up for the slog sweep, but this wasn't quite there. Tossed up, but it dipped on middle. Watson read it late and defends
swept away even as this was turning away on middle. Played in front of square and struck so powerfully. Was always in control of that shot as he came down on it
good length ball on leg, worked to midwicket
googly, tossed up way outside off. Watson plays with the turn and carts it to long-on
flighted on leg and turning away towards middle, Maxi is forward and nudges towards a vacant mid-on and they scamper through for a wonderfully crafted couple
length ball sent into orbit! Watto enjoyed that very much! Wears the biggest smile in the world after walloping this length ball mils into the crowd at deep square leg.
length ball outside off this time, but Watto's made too much room for himself to connect with his drive over extra

this is even better! Straight down the ground. Australia rollicking along! That showcases the power of the man, fullish on off stump and Watson plants his front foot down the pitch and smashes it straight over the bowler's head
good length ball with a bit of width, Watson thumps it to long-off
short and wide and Maxi's getting into the act! Cut behind point for an easy boundary. Kept it down, and placed it well. Slower ball gone awry there
short and outside off, mauled to deep midwicket. That's 18 off the over
fires in a leg-stump yorker, Maxi moves outside leg and looks to slog it. Gets a thick inside edge to deep square leg
136kph, good bouncer, right over the batsman's shoulder and angled in at him as well. Watson thought about a hook but doesn't act on it
sliced towards mid-off but it does not carry. Length ball just outside off, goes through with a slash but doesn't get all of it.

walks across his stumps to whip this away fine and is struck in line of middle. De Kock screams an appeal and the bowler joins in as an afterthought which I thought was strange, because this was pretty adjacent. Minor hiccup, or the start of a collapse?
slower ball, back of a length just outside off. Dabs with soft hands and he looks up at Watto to see if he was coming. He was and they scamper a single before the ball reaches the keeper
fullish and sliding down leg, turned away to deep square

skewed straight up and it falls into the waiting hands of cover and Tahir is pumped! This was tossed up well wide of off stump, but Watto was looking for the slog sweep. The turn snares the edge and the batsman has to walk back
hit away into the covers
flighted just outside off, Hodge comes forward and pushes wide of mid-on
tossed up outside off, Bailey wants to slog him to the leg side. Gets an inside edge to short fine leg
quicker and flatter on middle and leg, Hodge presents a straight bat to long-on
shortish and outside off, cut away to deep point
smoked over deep midwicket. He danced out to the pitch and hit with the turn. Nothing wrong with that strike. Even Mr Boycott might find it hard to disagree
advances again and this time JP drags it shorter and pushes it outside off. Punched into the covers

has he got it? No, just enough power to beat a back-pedaling Amla! He was rather off-balanced as he lofted this over the top. Good ball as he pushed it outside off to try and beat his reach. Almost succeeded, long-off went back and leapt up, but it evades him
full toss on middle and leg, punched to long-on
whipped away to deep midwicket
yorker just outside off, dug out to long-off and that's the victory for Australia!
